title: The Week-Long Adventure of Zelda Butler, Super-Coach

story.text: Zelda Butler discovers a mysterious watch that grants her the power to freeze time for everyone but herself. She decides to use this ability to help people correct their mistakes before they happen.
Zelda uses her new powers to avert a disastrous fall at the local community center. She freezes time, moves a slippery rug, and quietly resumes her day, proud but unseen.
Word is getting around about mysteriously avoided mishaps. Zelda feels more alive and purposeful than ever, mentoring people without them even knowing.
During a time freeze, Zelda overhears a plot to defraud her local charity. She gathers evidence while time is stopped and leaves anonymous tips for the local authorities.
Zelda reflects on her week and chooses to coach her grandson on standing up to bullies. Using her abilities, she orchestrates a heartwarming encounter that boosts his confidence.
Zelda saves a pet show from chaos. She pauses time to untangle leashes and aligns the pets perfectly. The show is a hit, and the participants are none the wiser.
After a week of secret heroics, Zelda sits back at a park, watching the world go by and smiling at the little imperfections that make life beautiful.

ending: As the sun sets on Sunday, Zelda tucks the mysterious watch away, ready to embrace tomorrow's challenges with or without magical aids.
moral: You don't need superpowers to make a super impact; often, unseen acts of kindness are the most heroic.
